story.storybody: On the hydel front, he said there are concerns On the hydel front, he said there are concerns surrounding certain environmental issues, studies of river basins and also about smaller hydel plants which are struggling. For wind, Goyal said the thrust will be on robust technology for scheduling and forecasting, expanding from state grids to regional grids and to get more transparency. The government is finalising a bidding process for wind projects, he said, adding plans are also afoot to award integrated solar manufacturing contracts which will be awarded to those asking for lowest subsidy. The Minister said he expects more states to come on board for the Uday bonds framework now that the elections are over, and added that he expects over Rs 2.20 trillion to be raised from these bonds in FY2017. This will include Rs 50,000 crore by the states which have already joined the scheme, Rs 1 trillion from the new entrants and around Rs 70,000 crore from discoms, he said, exuding confidence that in its search for good paper, the market will lap it up. The Minister also expressed confidence that economic growth, which touched 7.6 per cent last fiscal, will touch the double-digit mark next fiscal and will continue to be so for over a decade. His ministry is also in the final stages of finalising a new policy for the ultra mega power projects (UMPPs) under which he wants the projects to move into a `plug and play mode where the bidders operate in a more hassle-free manner with no permissions required, he said. Even though Sun Edison has filed for bankruptcy in the US, the minister expects investors to make a beeline for its assets here. The coal linkage auctions for the non-regulated sector will start next month, while for the coal linkages for the power sector, his ministry will be moving a Cabinet note in the next 30-45 days, Goyal said.
